briefTitle: A Study of Oral Methylnaltrexone (MNTX) for the Treatment of Opioid-Induced Constipation (OIC) in Participants With Chronic, Non-Malignant Pain
officialTitle: A Phase 3, Multicenter, Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled, Parallel-group Study of Oral Methylnaltrexone for the Treatment of Opioid-Induced Constipation in Subjects With Chronic, Non-Malignant Pain
summary: MNTX 3201 is a Phase 3, international, multicenter, randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled, parallel-group study to evaluate the safety and efficacy of oral MNTX for the treatment of opioid induced constipation in participants with chronic, non-malignant pain.

primaryOutcome.measure: Average Percentage of Dosing Days That Resulted in Rescue-Free Bowel Movements (RFBMs) Within 4 Hours of Dosing During Weeks 1 to 4
